This is the delay in minutes that the AutoTimer will wait on initial launch to not delay enigma2 startup time.
This is the delay in minutes that the AutoTimer will wait after a search to search the EPG again.

item.text: Only add timer for next x days
item.description: You can control for how many days in the future timers are added. Set this to 0 to disable this feature.
Enable this to be able to access the AutoTimer Overview from within the plugin browser.

item.text: Guess existing timer based on begin/end
item.description: If this is enabled an existing timer will also be considered recording an event if it records at least 80% of the it.
If a timer conflict occurs, AutoTimer will search outside the timespan for a similar event and add it.

item.text: Add timer as disabled on conflict
item.description: This toggles the behavior on timer conflicts. If an AutoTimer matches an event that conflicts with an existing timer it will not ignore this event but add it disabled.
If this is selected, the tag 'AutoTimer' will be given to timers created by this plugin.
If this is selected, the name of the respective AutoTimer will be added as a tag to timers created by this plugin.
By enabling this you will be notified about timer conflicts found during automated polling. There is no intelligence involved, so it might bother you about the same conflict over and over.
By enabling this you will be notified about similar timers added during automated polling. There is no intelligence involved, so it might bother you about the same conflict over and over.
